snippet: The film recounts in graphic detail the killings of an estimated 500,000 or more Indonesians during state-sponsored purges of suspected Communists and their sympathizers in 1965 and 1966.
abstract: Documentary The Act of Killing, about 500,000 or so Indonesians killed during state-sponsored purges of suspected Communists and their sympathizers in 1965 and 1966, has won dozens of awards but has not accomplished director Joshua Oppenheimer's greater goal; film has failed to provoke debate in Indonesia that could lead to formal government inquiry into murders.
lead_paragraph: The film recounts in graphic detail the killings of an estimated 500,000 or more Indonesians during state-sponsored purges of suspected Communists and their sympathizers in 1965 and 1966.

headline.main: ‘Act of Killing’ Film Fails to Stir Indonesia
headline.print_headline: ‘Act of Killing’ Film Fails to Stir Indonesia

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
